32F45DBAD4DD49D2BBAB8664C1A9F217.description: Use general academic and domain specific words and phrases accurately.

F935C9F937994547B15F6009E743481B.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within writing.

C047D5F9800F4BDBA66750F981E4F312.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when
considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

A89A54AF9A3E4EB3A11287AEAAC181A0.description: Use words, phrases, or gathered information to accurately reflect literary context.

44C3883394414437AC1C548B457AE559.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., slim, skinny,
scrawny, thin).

2E6EA6CB1D334835A9AF089DDFA49338.description: Identify the connotative meaning (the idea associated with the word) of a word or phrase.

4D6A9BBA3099462EBA25D5AC064C5A4F.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

CC8FE496F7804F8FA7F0D2448F5C1553.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification, allusions) in context.

B686AA3498394DC3A229CF0F6E1CB447.description: Identify allusion within a text or media.

943EDD530BCA426CAEDCE1B68DF96130.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, religious, and mythological allusions) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic,
condescending).

0379C73E8B7043798EBEFD887BB111E5.description: Verify the prediction of the meaning of a new word or phrase (e.g., by checking a dictionary).

F5B73E6257C34656B932BC6B3FA98395.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the precise meaning of a word.

5B25529A3D9E4A7E8699BAFF95C0ADD5.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the synonym for a word.

8639EE5E41964E389EA64EE29E1F411F.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation of a word.

2D56770ABE7047BEB7179C0BC97AE97E.description: Use context as a clue to determine the meaning of a grade appropriate word or phrases.

867EE2F827984460B11FD4F8D88C8C97.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).
b. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.
c. Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the
pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.
d. Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase.

0E42E5D027C143B8AE1B2166B8998822.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, by eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

69F943CB5C4C4A9E8C14246598D56A42.description: Use words, phrases, or gathered information to accurately reflect meaning.

966F7E4F90D44F4C81ED916C775EF0B6.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

9B894C473FFA4421A9795AF03A368F3A.description: Use commas to separate coordinate adjectives.

13A1D4E9FDE14505924FD05CE2D2FA01.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives.
b. Use correct spelling.

9DF74D34E1BE4D8889523E920ABCFCB7.description: Use simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences within writing when appropriate.

8405C0024F9644BDA54CFB0A3AB8F23A.description: Use phrases and clauses accurately within a sentence.

8CFA351B65904E27A7F24B94FBD229F7.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
a. Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.
b. Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing
relationships among ideas.
c. Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

C76790CF8D394EC49F9DBD5770CF2167.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

42DAEE1ED69244BA9BB1950C82588425.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 7
Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

ADF1A35F7399432AA18440EE58A2C596.description:
Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient
points.

5DED00DD44384372AB7420A0737437E7.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

1FFD7DBC7F1447B78D13BA9886C81F9B.description:
Report on a topic, with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details which support the main
ideas.

690E236D397D4D64BE8FBC5E33FC86E8.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and
examples.

380B5719C3B7439D8F56DEA8D80BFF9C.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, appropriate vocabulary,
facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

64A420253B1D47368D4E83F42B86F1F5.description: Evaluate the soundness or accuracy of reasons presented to support a claim.

84E0A192CA4F485FBB058FEEEC3FAC0B.description: Evaluate the soundness of reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of evidence provided in an argument.

1835750BD53E4859A46EA8208751849B.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the
evidence.

F3902D9F7CA84FE4844F0FD62B42BC35.description:
Identify how information on a topic or text presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally)
contributes to understanding.

043C582AE28744FAB242F30DDA82CD02.description:
Explain if and how ideas presented in diverse media (e.g., visually, personal communication, periodicals, social media) clarify
a topic, text, or issue under study.

C1FA69C23717402DB759C5B10F60C718.description:
Critically evaluate main ideas and details presented in diverse media (e.g., visually, personal communication, periodicals,
social media) and formats for accuracy.

C575ADEA8AD54B5385F9C1C0F3CF2626.description:
Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, and orally) and explain
how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

4093742C9915429FAC29FAD46D7D39E6.description: Discuss how own view or opinion changes using new information provided by others.

393D80EA7BD241F5BB543426FA505D23.description: Describe how the claims within a speaker's argument match own argument.

4EE6EEBE953F4A95863E3132D8F58167.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics,
texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence
on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion. b. Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.
c. Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the
discussion back on topic as needed.
d. Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

DB6F350BC9C84B0EA471B86C0457D23E.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

01C47864D9BA4404A2D7D3703A03B6F5.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

92A7DB259BA9425BA83CCC0CA5D9EF7C.description: Provide evidence from grade appropriate literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

69A66F1732014BFE8CDA66D5CA622419.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grade 7 Reading standards to informational text and nonfiction.

3B28248ACB1949689566E08C16BB1E38.description: Use a standard format to write citations.

C423C0428ED046B59085F2E36D673D5A.description: Use a standard format to write citations.

474333681EE142B2A4F687C084325A5D.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

BD0430407411411EAE69371FE344115E.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

5A0D17AE08604D809B6B598FFE9A1FDC.description:
Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic or text from print and/or digital
sources.

18C2D0CF03AE4249A342107D2A7C0BE7.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital
sources.

FF474134877F41C2AA3BB6B1DDBBCC35.description: List internet search terms for a topic of study.

E1E20CBB502A4F92B24EB6C00F0BF7B2.description: List internet search terms for a topic of persuasive writing.

4ED196F2F342437794AC12F290157B45.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each
source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

BCE59D9124C8421D9A4DFEC58F152B06.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determining topic, locating information on a topic, organizing
information related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

25DA790BD52E4FA689E5D8D8570AC56A.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for
further research and investigation.

740CD9FB6E954466B1BCD8BCDBC1CD03.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

7A22EEED784845A38BB3182B475A3FCF.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use internet to gather information; use word processing to generate and
collaborate on writing).

392E7EA7DE514555933B3F86D5F246DA.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

BD459EAC1E2C4332B42DB6A204E0F216.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

F0EDFCCD0FF847CDA67924E0F3647EF2.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing (e.g., review product,
strengthening story).

8AE8E42336B9485FAF4F58BD1AF64C98.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

731F48F2CBEE4875B029438C2FE29837.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

136F506170164F23AE85EB6F677A1D66.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements,
develop storyline, conclude story).

E97A42A23F024BC3BE6BB24D18E2C0BF.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., define purpose, which is to persuade, state
your claim, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

FBBBF124761540E28A5A2C202B50D42D.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or
trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate
command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 7.)

923452C6E28E47B39A9CEB9DDC46E78D.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to persuade), and
audience.

695CC4A7B8C44F92B0AC935995D021E1.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g. to entertain), and
audience.

E0E01533AB1F40EC8B83AFDF2C7C9511.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), and
audience (reader).

97980C3192C4431B900A29DACF3C3CA9.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Gradespecific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above).

4EE355C544764CB5A2495EE7587FDAAA.description: Use words, phrases, or gathered information to accurately reflect literary context.

867EA1E60E6F460084B1A3CB466ED0AC.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

B1A507B67686489DA851D856A5B67BF7.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey
experiences and events.

EC1F7E6A59D444EB873A8D1823DA64B1.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting
to another.

B86A9D0C4B6B4A54AA7580CDA1558243.description:
When appropriate use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

923F8B706FC04112830A53C0AB2F1271.description: Organize ideas and event so that they unfold naturally.

A24660302B444C0E9761955D21F7C4FF.description: Orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing the narrator and/or characters.

0361F0DA3DA04667A3C80C1731EFF586.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured
event sequences.
a. Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.
b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
c. Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.
d. Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

2648182011DA402092B1A17373F7294C.description:
Report on a topic, with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details which support the main
ideas.

0EB012D94C874FC88FBE497B4219D3CF.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and
examples.

3A723195D8144700858299E4B94F030E.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information presented.

EC658B4EB293444BA9F143642E4C3DEE.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

3E633B5074144DD38EC09ABD9B39B594.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

2E21D1CC58664C68B8019913C3577573.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

C2A5F5D7EA334182A47482D58B6FAD51.description:
Develop the topic (add additional information related to the topic) with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations,
or other information and examples.

7BF2A0CB02D04948AE58BE42AC443ED9.description: Write an introduction that clearly previews information to follow.

0A7B49706C9046F197DC2B4044C36D4C.description: Organize ideas, concepts, and information (using definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect).

4F1B8795C2DC43BDA47BAF8280F2C7E2.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and
analysis of relevant content.
a. Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition,
classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when
useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.
c. Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.
d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
e. Establish and maintain a formal style.
f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

BC2A920885DE40E7ABC5FAED245FED2C.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that supports and summarizes the argument presented.

0FCC2CC6204D4EA88FC489C2741BF18C.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

FACF1CC014FB44A8AC485796C861AD6E.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to link opinions and reasons and clarify relationship of ideas.

7E2DF72ED58C40C9B135F48B3D7D0C8F.description: Write arguments to support claims with logical reasoning and relevant evidence from credible sources.

7B5A8E464EAC493BA4D51E45B83469C0.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's claim.

0BF641C2BF5A467FAFCF45A32306F44A.description: Write an introduction that introduces the writer's claims and acknowledges alternate or opposing claims.

01FB9380D0704DC5800DF63B3900FACF.description:
Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.
a. Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.
b. Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the
topic or text.
c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.
d. Establish and maintain a formal style.
e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

82C680B926354548BE8441A191AA5176.description:
Use a variety of strategies (e.g., use context, affixes and roots, use reference materials) to derive meaning from a variety of
print/non-print texts.

DA8283FF5EF741A9B2D1AE8B3F038628.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts including historical novels, periodicals, dramas or plays, poetry (including soliloquies
and sonnets), fiction and nonfiction novels.

6D995F80B1B84808AF3ACEFAD359B452.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts and nonfiction in a text complexity range
determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 7.

834D85A80CFE4AF5A0BEAE75DD760AFF.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B6CF5C024A78446E84685B9254BF5BDA.description:
Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing
different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

0E75F5EDDB394353BB6875A6DCB60568.description: Compare/contrast how two or more authors write about the same topic.

D02FFB0EA88C47E79FE00CE045BD39B5.description: Use supporting evidence to summarize central ideas, draw inferences, or analyze connections within or across texts.

2BE55A02656E42BBB9FAAE889EDCEF2D.description:
Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different
evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

BFFBADD17F404FC4BF239CAD47B7C889.description: Distinguish claims or arguments from those that are supported by evidence from those that are not.

9F58C329D5E54B9EB30B871C9279134C.description: Evaluate the claim or argument to determine if they are supported by evidence.

E0303CB97A2D4057BC6CAB647B64A2CB.description: Identify an argument or claim that the author makes.

19B4C8CC27D045DE9AC5D9C954158A59.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and
sufficient to support the claims.

D9999951339443DF8E321ED610A266A0.description: Compare/contrast how two or more authors write or present about the same topic.

FD4E6859ED964745906A8BBF20A81F85.description:
Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how
the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

BE72DDE322DA4DCA80314C4ACC7E87F1.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that
of others.

C652689EF4F34875A3C8882DA04C00E6.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or
her position from that of others.

38FF83BCDD354A7D91667ED92733B8B1.description: Determine how the information in each section contribute to the whole or to the development of ideas.

CDC1C5BB69504ED2959351F1CDF7DEC4.description: Determine the structure of a text.

4A3A580DCA074482BCFB881ABAD61910.description: Outline a given text to show how ideas build upon one another

9AE011254DBF4D2B96086C445B478930.description: Use signal words as a means of locating information.

1E1FB5E36FC949AAA10C56A2652F6DBE.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of
the ideas.

3C2C5AD3931340F698781D648AE5E886.description: Analyze how the use of figurative, connotative or technical terms affect the meaning or tone of text.

757172057CA544D48EB0A7DDB8DE243E.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

9C0D2243A82942A78072E78FA76BB9F5.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the
impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone.

072013F025B64CA0A8EE4437F78B4D84.description:
Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how
individuals influence ideas or events).

3F421801001245699194175D057EBA24.description:
Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals
influence ideas or events).

D0FB2BE8E9FB41D2B6F7ED0F2239AC17.description: Provide/create an objective summary of a text.

40EC104F2EAD4738979926950E3D7AFA.description: Analyze the development of the central idea over the course of the text.

5D087179E2B84263BFDBBC29C7429F20.description: Determine the central idea of a text.

9551813137E84FB5AFB51BEF35E42002.description:
Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the
text.

D5CFB86325D642E9B1A4F42251898319.description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to support inferences, conclusions, or summaries of text.

ADB83B3747554550BB9311D64837A419.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

8CA95290BAB942149736CDCCCD1C2CA4.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of literary texts.

B7D9B010CC6A46C596D1941676F5CFDC.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including historical novels, periodicals, dramas or plays, poetry
(including soliloquies and sonnets), fiction and nonfiction novels.

9BA7961C08C741698A3A6E5C74D6BCE5.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 7.

D17549C267DB45AB871996BFF5AC6F25.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

027F0985039B4E139EAF78228127C987.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a
means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

6C06E928809840349132F060E10FEAB3.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of
understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

FD4FADF3A9D1434DBDD1E3F4997FA99A.description:
Compare and contrast different mediums that may be used to present literary materials to explore the techniques used in the
various mediums.

7B3ED788FC8A49C5A42ED65839652A6A.description: Compare and contrast a story, drama, or poem when presented in two different mediums.

C484FA5460404C728F53D189492D66F9.description:
Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques
unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

0238EDAC3C16432D9C5E8D396D1A6260.description: Compare and contrast the points of view of different characters in the same text.

9FA6749E01D34273B04BD57565321BB3.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

15BE2ACC525A434FA26D6688619DF8CF.description: Examine how the structure of a poem or drama adds to its meaning.

BAC0788CBCCD4A578A89526DAA3F4F7D.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how a drama or poem’s form or structure contributes to its meaning.

D77B952BAE0742409647239427A9A888.description: Analyze how the use of rhymes or repetitions of sounds affect the tone of the poem, story, or drama.

66E85E840C164D02A517F0E52BC164E3.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

08EDF2009E1C420EBDD242A9EB04B6BB.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of
specific word choices on meaning and tone, including rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of
a poem or section of a story or drama.

7E3DD24798504335B12A02DBD541FF45.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

665FBB857A9E4560B860BE47BC9A73DE.description: Analyze the impact of story elements on the text (e.g., impact of setting on a character's choices, cause/effects within the text).

735CE05166BC4E9EBDEAD44A830BC8E9.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

9F7871BBB183482087E8289AF158E716.description: Analyze the development of the theme or central idea over the course of the text.

17C000E019394A00BF925B883A4CF442.description: Determine the theme or central idea of a text.

D2163F9987984FDD9C89545BE1A1AFC2.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

A71058EFB77D4B4EA2910C82911D5C1E.description: Use two or more pieces of textual evidence to support conclusions, or summaries of text.

FB9F2B890A654622A7D1A097DBD2DFF3.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

2384417F81F8400B918DB569C0F7CF6D.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
